thread.title: Mariners celebrate homecoming sweep of visiting Eagles
thread.title_full: Mariners celebrate homecoming sweep of visiting Eagles

author: news@courierpublicationsllc.com (Staff)
title: Mariners celebrate homecoming sweep of visiting Eagles
text:
High school boys and girls soccer Mariners celebrate homecoming sweep of visiting Eagles Oceanside girls remain unbeaten, first in Class B North By Staff | Oct 12, 2015 
Thomaston â€” It was a banner day for the Oceanside boys and girls high school soccer teams on Saturday, Oct. 10 as the Mariners hosted Lincoln Academy of Newcastle in a doubleheader, held in conjunction with the school's homecoming festivities. 
There certainly was reason to celebrate by day's end as the Mariners netted wins over the Eagles, with the girls earning a 3-0 victory in the morning contest and boys a 4-1 decision in the afternoon session. 
Photos from these games will appear soon with this story. 
The following is a recap of both contests: 
Girls soccer 
Oceanside 3, Lincoln Academy 0 
At Thomaston Oct. 10, the Mariners remained atop the Class B North waters as they blanked the Eagles to remain undefeated. Oceanside led 1-0 at halftime. 
Abby Veilleux, Makenna Brooks and Casey Pine scored, while Pine, Brooks, Brianna Dugan and Cassidy Boynton logged assists for the hosts. 
Oceanside held a 20-3 edge in shots, 6-1 edge in corner kicks and 6-3 edge in direct kicks. Kayln Grover made three saves in net for the Mariners, while Christine Hilton made 17 saves in goal for the Eagles. 
With time winding down in the first half, the Mariners got on the board when Pine passed the ball to Veilleux, who fired a hard shot through the grasp of the Lincoln Academy keeper and into the net with 49 seconds remaining. 
The hosts doubled their advantage a minute into the second half when Brooks booted a deep kick that was corralled by Pine on the run, as she creased the net. 
Brooks later scored a goal with 11:55 left when she skimmed a header off assists by Dugan and Boynton. 
In the Maine Principals' Association Heal Point Standings for Class B North, Oceanside (10-0-1, 115.3571 points) is first in the 18-team region. The top 12 teams qualify for the playoffs. 
Boys soccer 
Oceanside 4, Lincoln Academy 1 
At Thomaston Oct. 10, the Mariners pounced on the Eagles in the game's first minute and sailed to a three-goal win. Oceanside led 2-0 at halftime. 
Andrew King netted two goals and added an assist in the win for Oceanside, while Christian Straka (goal), Zach Robinson (goal) and Sam Townsend (assist) also chipped in for the hosts. 
Aaron Gonzalez scored for Lincoln Academy. 
Oceanside held an 11-10 edge in shots as Mariner keeper Coby Dorr made nine saves on 10 shots and Karan Nair seven in goal for the Eagles. 
King got things going quickly for Oceanside when he received the ball over the top from a midfielder and, after it deflected off a Lincoln Academy defender, King was off to the races as he beat the keeper on a one-on-one a mere 45 seconds into the contest. 
King struck again with 10:15 remaining in the half when he got a nice pass from Townsend on a give-and-go as the half ended with the hosts ahead 2-0. 
Gonzalez put the visitors on the board at the 31:39-mark, but Straka put Oceanside back up by two scores when he scored, off an assist from King. 
Robinson got credit for the fourth score, which was a Lincoln Academy own-goal as the ball went off a defender and into the net. 
In the Maine Principals' Association Heal Point Standings for Class B North, Oceanside (7-2-2, 77.0663 points) is third, while Ellsworth (10-0-1, 110.9439 points) is first in the 18-team region. The top 12 teams qualify for the playoffs.
